channel.title: Do these sites work?
channel.description: ok so you know when you see the little ads that say click here to recieve your free ipod, TV, laptop, desktop, game console, or whatever it may be. Then you have to complete an offer and have "x" number of other people to complete an offer too. well does it really work? Because i read a tut on i think sythe that told you all about it(before sythe got hacked) but of course its not there anymore.

item.title: Do these sites work?
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

mjordan:

well sometimes on the offers that you have to pick from and complete one, there is an AOL or blockbuster one. and it says like “FREE AOL!!!” then in small letters it says " for the first month". so if you cancel before a month is out then you wont have to pay a penny for your free item. has anyone ever gotten anything free from these sites?

I Got a free domain from domain lagoon. But it expired in 2 months, they said a year. Cheap bastards.
And i had to click about 100 Ads -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Do these sites work?
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

mjordan:

ok so you know when you see the little ads that say click here to recieve your free ipod, TV, laptop, desktop, game console, or whatever it may be. Then you have to complete an offer and have “x” number of other people to complete an offer too. well does it really work? Because i read a tut on i think sythe that told you all about it(before sythe got hacked) but of course its not there anymore.

Some Do.
Some Dont.

When they get you to click ALOT! of ads. It means they are possibly giving something away.

When it just asks you to refer people. It may be a scam.

But thats from my knowledge

Read full topic
